title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 § 130.12 - Appeal to the Commissioner
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 § 130.12 - Appeal to the Commissioner

State Regulations

Persons considering themselves aggrieved by an LSA's
substantial equivalency determination may file an appeal to the Commissioner
within 30 days of the LSA's decision pursuant to Education Law §310 and section
275.16
of this Title, and the

Commissioner may, in his or her discretion, stay such determination pending a
final determination on such appeal pursuant to Education Law §311 and section
276.1
of this

Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§
130.12

Adopted

New

York State Register September 28, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 39, eff. 9/28/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
